title: FinOps Cloud Lead
description:
The Infrastructure team at Squarespace ensures the scalability, security, and efficiency of our cloud environment. We are dedicated to driving continuous improvements across our infrastructure. As cloud usage becomes an important operational indicator for our business, we are looking for a FinOps Lead to help manage and optimize our cloud-related expenditures.



The FinOps Lead will be a critical player in promoting a culture of cost accountability and awareness regarding Squarespace's cloud usage. Your role will involve building, maintaining, and supporting financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and consumption analysis related to cloud infrastructure. Working closely with engineering, finance, and product teams, the FinOps Lead will identify opportunities and implement process improvements, establish governance and transparency around cloud cost management.



You will report to our VP of Infrastructure and be based hybrid in our NYC headquarters.


**You'll Get To...**
--------------------


* Collaborate with teams in engineering, finance, and product to design and implement a comprehensive FinOps program roadmap.
* Develop dashboards and reports to monitor and analyze cloud consumption, promoting proactive cost optimization.
* Build financial models and provide accurate forecasts for cloud spending.
* Identify opportunities to improve existing processes and governance related to cloud cost management.
* Evaluate data patterns to extract actionable insights for strategic and operational decision-making.
* Drive continuous improvements in cost management processes, reporting, and visibility across the organization.
* Devise dashboards and reports that monitor cloud usage.
* Develop strategies to optimize cloud-related expenditures in preparation for a cloud migration


**Who We're Looking For**
-------------------------


* 5+ years of experience in cloud cost management, FinOps, or a related role.
* Background in financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting within cloud environments.
* Experience with cloud platform technology, GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Experience with data visualization tools to monitor and report on cloud usage.
* Experienced in collaborating with engineering, finance, and product teams.


**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------


* A choice between medical plans with an option for 100% covered premiums
* Health Savings Account with Squarespace funding
* Fertility and adoption benefits
* Supplemental Insurance plans
* Headspace mindfulness app subscription
* Retirement benefits with employer match
* Flexible paid time off
* 12 to 20 weeks of paid family leave
* Equity plan for all employees
* $100 per month remote Stipend
* Access to supplemental insurance plans for additional coverage
* Education reimbursement
* Employee donation match to community organizations
* 6 Global Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
* Hack week twice per year!


### **Cash Compensation Range: $148,500 - $239,200 USD**



The base salary for this position will vary based on job-related criteria including relevant skills, experience, and location, among other factors.



In addition to the cash compensation above (which includes base salary and, where applicable for eligible roles, may include on-target commissions or overtime pay), all Squarespace employees are eligible to receive equity in the company as part of their total compensation.


**About Squarespace**
---------------------



Squarespace (NYSE: SQSP) is a design-driven platform helping entrepreneurs build brands and businesses online. We empower millions of customers in more than 200 countries and territories with all the tools they need to create an online presence, build an audience, monetize, and scale their business. Our suite of products range from websites, domains, ecommerce, and marketing tools, as well as tools for scheduling with Acuity, creating and managing social media presence with Bio Sites and Unfold, and hospitality business management via Tock. Our team of more than 1,700 is headquartered in bustling New York City, with offices in Chicago, Dublin, Ireland, Aveiro, Portugal, and coworking spaces in the UK, Netherlands, and Australia. For more information about our company culture, visit www.squarespace.com/about/careers.


**Our Commitment**
------------------



Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customers, but we also work toward the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. title: Manager, Marketing Channel Analytics & Operations
description:
Squarespace is seeking a Manager to lead our Marketing Channel Analytics and Operations team.



You and your team will power our growth strategy and investments through innovative analytical, process and technology solutions to help us scale our operations and grow our brand, subscribers and revenue efficiently. The depth and breadth of our marketing activities, from award-winning ad campaigns to multi-product CRM, and our growing portfolio of markets, products and brands means you'll solve complex questions with significant opportunity to influence business results.



You are an exceptional analyst, business partner and people manager with expertise in cross-channel marketing data, measurement, process and technology solutions and success in setting and achieving roadmaps and milestones.


**This is a hybrid role working from our New York City headquarters** (3 days per week). You'll report to the Director of Acquisition & Revenue Analytics.


**You'll Get To…**
------------------


* Lead a team of skilled data and operations analysts to achieve business results, operational efficiency and career growth
* Build cohesive partnerships across Marketing, Data Science, Engineering and other departments to drive our strategy, roadmap and outcomes
* Deliver innovative analytical, process and technology solutions to maximize scale and performance across paid and unpaid marketing channels, reflect industry best practices and serve a growing portfolio of Squarespace products and brands
* Surface relevant business insights and market trends to senior leaders and empower business partners to understand and act on key metrics through self-service tooling

* Experience setting and achieving roadmaps, project plans and milestones
* **Exceptional communicator and relationship builder who can navigate organizational complexity and drive alignment across functions and levels, including, experience working with VP and C-suite level stakeholders.**

title: School Social Worker
description:
**School Social Worker needed in the Bronx!**  

 **9am-5pm!**
**Overview**  

The school social worker will provide expertise to deliver successful outcomes for the following objective:  

* Works collaboratively with all stakeholders in providing the highest quality of services to children, families and staff.
* Directs the development and implementation of the Mental Health plans in compliance with the New York City Department of Education regulations
* Reviews and evaluate existing program and update annual Mental Health plans, in conjunction with Advisory Committee, parents, community representatives, and staff.
* Develops and implements a plan and system for monitoring and evaluating Mental Health activities. Determine areas of weakness and make recommendations for corrective action.
* Assists in the coordination of other Mental Health components.
* Meets regularly with site director and other Specialists to coordinate efforts to implement the program.
* Prepares monthly reports of Mental Health activities and submits them to the site director and Advisory Committee.

  

**Works collaboratively with parents/families by:**  

* Soliciting family information from the enrollment conference, meetings, home visits, classroom observations, parent meetings, team meetings, and telephone

conversations.
  

* Performing and sharing classroom and behavioral/social/emotional observations with families, as necessary.
* Performing and sharing classroom and behavioral/social/emotional observations with families, as necessary.
* Discussing strengths and concerns about a student's mental health with family members. Including age-appropriate development and behavior as well as how to

appropriately respond to a child.
  

* Supporting families in any needed mental health interventions including making referrals to local mental health agencies.

  

**Provides a regular schedule of mental health consultation involving program** **staff and families which includes:**  

* The design and implementation of program practices which are responsive to the identified behavioral and mental health issues.
* Assists in providing special help for children with atypical behaviors utilizing the Creative Curriculum, ASQ, and community mental health resources.
* Conducts classroom observations for students with developmental and behavioral challenges.
* Develops behavior team meeting agendas and working collaboratively to create behavior intervention plans.
* Provides in-service education and trainings to staff on a variety of mental health topics
* Develops and maintains relationships with local community agencies which serve the preschool population in the Mt. Hope/Burnside and Fordham/Bedford Park area of the Bronx.
* Attends monthly Goal Setting meetings.
* Helps plan and facilitate the Health Advisory Committee with the Health & Nutrition Specialists.
* Works collaboratively with all staff in provision of services to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery to students and family.
* Enters data. Assessments, screening information into data collection system
* Provides adequate safeguards to maintain the privacy and confidentiality of information per program and regulatory agency policies.
* Maintains knowledge of current trends in assessment, service delivery and best practices by participating in staff development and professional conferences to remain current in

the field of mental health.
  

* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

**QUALIFICATIONS** :
  

* Graduate of an Accredited College or University with a Master's of Social Work or equivalent Master's level degree in counseling, gerontology, psychology or related field.

**Salary:** Position is a *temp to perm position.* Salary for temp portion is **$33/hour.**



**For more information or to schedule an interview, please contact:**  

**Howard Newman**  

*Account Manager, Bond Health Staffing*  

5824 12th Avenue  

Brooklyn, NY, 11219  

Office: 1-718-302-0040 ext. 204  

Fax: 1-718-302-0070
  

Howard@bondhealthstaffing.com

title: Beauty Sales Consultant
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dynamic Beauty Consultant to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for beauty products and providing exceptional customer service.

**Responsibilities**  
- Communicate effectively with customers to understand their beauty needs  
- Provide personalized recommendations and upsell products based on customer preferences  
- Manage social media platforms to promote beauty products and engage with customers  
- Conduct product demonstrations to showcase the benefits of various beauty items  
- Maintain a professional phone etiquette when interacting with clients  
- Deliver outstanding customer service to ensure a positive shopping experience  
- Drive retail sales by assisting customers in selecting the right beauty products

- Manage front desk duties including appointment scheduling and check-ins

**Qualifications**

**Merchandiser - Flexible, Part time, Start now!**

Footprint Solutions is a nationally recognized company and industry leader; for over 20 years we have partnered with well-known retailers to provide them with total onsite management capabilities. We perform both merchandising and installation services within our customer’s retail space. We are well versed in the stores we serve.

**What is your role at footprint Solutions?**
---------------------------------------------


The Retail Merchandiser will play an essential role in our brand partnership connection while helping our retail customers manage and display their products. Merchandisers may implement plan-o-gram updates, stock displays or shelves, complete surveys and audits, assist in store remodels, or tag products with security materials among other responsibilities. You will be servicing multiple locations and customers on a reoccurring basis within a predetermined territory.

title: Floor Manager
description:
**Position Purpose:**this person will be in command of overall operations of the restaurant in the absence of General Manager and Assistant General Manager.




Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

Managerial

* Facilitate coaching, counseling opportunities and disciplinary discussions to employees.
* Interview, assess and select employees for employment with AGM/GM.
* Direct daily work activities of all scheduled staff including but not limited to floor plans, section assignment & side work.
* Monitor, manage and report and discrepancies with registers between shifts.
* Responsible for overall grooming service staff.
* Monitor what works and what does not and communicate your observations and suggestions for improvements.
* Assist with training of all new hired and existing staff and training materials generation.
* Focus on specifically assigned area of restaurant needs that need attention when requested by
* General Manager – such as beverage, wine sales, service, etc.


Service

* Communicate all guest related issues or requests to the appropriate service staff and culinary team and guide them towards succession.
* Support staff with any tasks, resolve operational and employee issues and communicate and/or consult resolution with General Manager and/or Assistant General Manager.
* Personalize service by leading by example (e.g., using guest’s name, building relationships with guests to achieve loyalty


and build regular clientele, check on satisfaction by being involved and speaking with every guest dining with us, etc.)

* Represent all products and present them to our customers explaining the brand and flavors using skilled sales techniques.
* Monitor and make sure quality of food and beverages is at its highest.
* Personally handle the service in the dining room and oversee the service staff and flow of entire restaurant by being present on the floor during all meal periods when scheduled.

Product Presentation

* Monitor and make sure quality of food and beverages is at its highest.
* Assist with inventories if requested by GM and AGM – beverage, china/glassware/silverware.
* Responsible for freshness and look of the florals of the entire dining room and overall decoration and esthetics of outdoor area and the dining room; communicate needs to AGM/GM.




Labor Management

* Direct daily work activities of all scheduled staff – floor plans, section assignment, side work, etc,
* Continually review performance and attendance of all staff - address shortcomings and recognize success.
* Serve as a role model and mentor by setting a positive example in all aspects of business and personnel management.
* Support and work closely with the rest of the management team so as team you uphold the service and hospitality standards in the restaurant.
* Work closely with staff to establish a group-hospitality minded employees who will develop and maintain our philosophy and values.
* Understand, follow and direct others in current safety procedures.




Administrative

* Monitor and ensure the accuracy of menus, wine list, beer and house cocktail lists and POS postings.
* Find a way to actively respond to all company/operation emails whenever possible and always in professional manner (not on the floor in the view of the guests and not during the service)
* Participate and monitor Avero reports regarding the daily performance of the restaurant.
* Follow up on all needed repairs immediately by informing GM and AGM or directly calling appropriate maintenance persons, be present and communicate outcome in detail to all involved and Avero.
* Attend all necessary meetings scheduled by General Manager, Director of Operations, or ownership.




Financial


* Suggest promotions and bring revenue increase ideas, train staff on up selling, build guest loyalty by touching every single table, monitor schedules and actual hours worked, etc.
* Monitor and manage registers between shifts.
* Enforce federal, state, and local laws including health & labor



Self-Development




It is understood that as Floor Manager you are responsible to maintain current knowledge of the world of restaurants when it comes to food, wine, beer, and spirits. You will be required to continually develop this knowledge on your own time and stay on top of current industry trends. Your progress in education will be evaluated on ongoing basis. Likewise, the company will assist in any way possible with any educational goals that relate to your duties as Assistant General Manager (with prior management approval).




**Minimal Essential Requirements:**

* The ability to work as part of a team, and personal cleanliness.
* Food handling, preparation, and cleaning skills are welcomed. Food handler’s certification required.
* Ability to communicate and understand direction in English to ensure safety in the workplace. Ability to understand, respond, and engage with co-workers, managers, and guests in English.
* Time management and ability to work under pressure to manage high volume of production.
* Active listening and learning skills.
* Reading and speaking comprehension skills.
* Discipline to follow set standards.
* Ability to lift up to 25lbs.

**ADA:** SA Hospitality Group will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990  

  

This job description will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and marginal job functions are subject to modification.  

#sama

title: Bartender
description:
Major Food Group is hiring experienced Bartenders to join our team at THE LOBSTER CLUB!


As a valuable addition to our team, you must ensure that guests have a pleasant and memorable dining experience. The ideal candidates will be passionate and have a commanding knowledge about food, wine, and service in general.


These individuals will be the key points of contact for guests throughout their dining experience. They must have the ability to work well with the team and provide the utmost level of hospitality to our guests.


RESPONSIBILITIES

* Prepare alcohol or non-alcohol beverages for bar and restaurant patrons
* Interact with customers, take orders and serve snacks and drinks
* Assess customers’ needs and preferences and make recommendations
* Mix ingredients to prepare cocktails
* Plan and present bar menu
* Check customers’ identification and confirm it meets legal drinking age
* Restock and replenish bar inventory and supplies
* Stay guest focused and nurture an excellent guest experience
* Comply with all food and beverage regulations
* Greet guests in a timely manner and take orders
* Process cash and credit card transactions following appropriate procedures
* Maintain a safe and clean environment for guests and team
* Monthly liquor inventory
* Inventory variance analysis
* Order all liquor product
* Order bar sundries – ice, garnishes, bar mixers
* Inventory efficiency – ensure all product has application and purpose
* Invoice processing
* Receive and stock liquor product
* Liquor room - cleanliness and organization




REQUIREMENTS:

* The position requires at least 3 years of experience in the desired job
* Must be able to stand/walk for 8 hours; bend, push, pull; lift 30 lbs.
* Ability to work on-site for assigned schedule including nights, weekends and holidays
* Ability to operate point-of-sales system accurately and efficiently
* Deep knowledge of spirits, classic cocktails, wine, beer and proper technique
* Proficient in computer skills including POS systems, Word and Excel.
* Experience in high-volume restaurants is a plus.


BENEFITS:

* Competitive Salary
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance with Company subsidy
* Growth Opportunities
* Progressive Paid Time Off
* Parental Leave
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Generous Dining Allowance
* Unlimited Referral Program
* TransitChek Discount


Equal Employment Opportunity

title: Lead Host
description:
La Grande Boucherie is looking for a warm and inviting **Lead Host**who is excited to join our team.  

  

Our Lead Hosts provide a warm welcome to guests entering La Grande Boucherie, guide guests to their table, provide introduction to the menus and assigned server, and offering a genuine farewell and gratitude to departing guests. In addition, Lead Hosts are responsible for organizing guest reservations, special events, and arranging table assignments for the entire floor plan, while giving clear directions to the hosts throughout each shift.  

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* Lively atmosphere
* Company perks

What you will bring to us:* Previous Host experience in a quality restaurant
* Familiarity with Open Table
* Customer-oriented approach and patience
* Excellent people skills
  

Our Company:


The Group is a collection of restaurants based in New York City, embodying passion, integrity and excellence. Our latest location, LA GRANDE BOUCHERIE aims to become a Parisian square in Midtown and one of the most authentically French dining destinations in Manhattan. This one-of-a-kind brasserie evokes the optimism from the turn of the century and is our largest and most esteemed restaurant.


In addition to an extensive wine list and classic drinks, Boucherie has developed a beverage program that boasts an inspired menu of absinthe-driven signature cocktails  

  

Our concepts are intricate and intentional. As we grow in New York City, we are also growing across the US! We are proud to have invested in the city over the past 10+ years and are looking forward to creating future spaces that embody our passion for timeless tradition.

description:
**Direct Support Professional Livingston, NJ**

We are looking for a strong, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual to work with a 23- year-old woman living at home with her family.

This young woman is looking forward to spending time with someone who could offer opportunities for human connection to learn, build new skills, and create empathic, trusting relationships. This would include providing inspiring activities, motivating tasks, and sharing enjoyable time.

This young woman needs a dynamic support person who is gentle and compassionate while assisting her in following through on tasks. Although her disability can make some activities challenging, she is looking for someone who can encourage her to find new experiences that are engaging and rewarding.

We are looking for a person with experience in the health and human services field, including a therapist (OT, PT, speech, medical, ABA practitioner), special education teacher, au pair, nanny, mother’s helper, nurse, physician’s assistant, home health aide, health care related intern, student studying in the health and human services field.

We are looking for someone who will work with a team of professionals towards building relationships with the person and support her to realize her potential and build her future. They need to provide one-to-one mentoring support in a variety of daily activities.

* Candidates must clear a background check and drug screening.
* Must have a valid driver’s license, a clean driving record, and a reliable vehicle for transportation,

title: Paralegal - Join our growing team!
description:
**PARALEGAL**

**Company Overview:**

Our legal team at Guards Law is partnered with a reputable and growing debt restructuring company dedicated to providing financial solutions and relief to individuals burdened by debt. Together, we assist clients in achieving debt freedom and financial stability through strategic debt management plans. We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Paralegal to join our dynamic team in Wall Township NJ and play a key role in helping our clients regain control of their financial future.

**Job Summary:**

As a Paralegal at our debt restructuring company, you will be an integral part of our legal team, providing essential support to attorneys and clients throughout the debt restructuring process. Your primary responsibilities will involve conducting legal research, preparing legal documents, and facilitating communication between clients, attorneys, and creditors. The successful candidate will be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational skills, and have a genuine passion for helping others overcome financial challenges.

**Responsibilities:**

· Conduct thorough legal research and analysis on debt restructuring laws, regulations, and best practices.

· Prepare legal documents, including debt restructuring agreements, contracts, and settlement proposals.

· Assist attorneys in drafting legal correspondence and pleadings related to debt consolidation cases.

· Communicate and liaise with clients, creditors, and legal partners to ensure smooth case progression and timely resolution.

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions and case details in our database.

· Monitor and track the status of debt restructuring cases and keep all stakeholders informed of developments.

· Provide exceptional customer service to clients by addressing inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.

· Stay informed about industry trends, changes in debt restructuring laws, and updates on creditor practices.

· Collaborate with the legal team to improve internal processes and enhance overall efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

· Associate degree in Paralegal Studies or related field; Bachelor's degree is a plus

· Paralegal certificate

· Proven experience as a Paralegal in debt restructuring or related legal field

· Knowledge of debt restructuring laws, consumer finance regulations, and creditor practices

· Excellent research, writing, and communication skills

· Proficiency in legal research tools and database management

· Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously

· Empathetic and professional demeanor with the ability to handle sensitive client matters

· Team player with a commitment to achieving collective goals

**Benefits**:

Health Insurance

Paid Time Off

This position offers a competitive salary along with opportunities for professional growth and development within the legal field. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for law, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Paralegal. Join our team today and be part of a company that makes a meaningful impact on people's lives!

To apply, submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and interest in this position. We look forward to reviewing your application.

*Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required for the role of Paralegal at our debt restructuring company. Actual job responsibilities and qualifications may vary depending on the specific needs of the company.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

* Paid time off

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Experience:

* Paralegal: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Wall Township, NJ (Required)

title: TEAP Specialist
description:
**Duties/Responsibilities:**

· Designs, develops, and implements all programs related to substance use and abuse prevention and intervention in conjunction with the Mental Health Consultant, Counseling, and Health Services staff, Center Physician and Center Director.

· Coordinates all programs designed to reduce and eliminate substance use and abuse.

· Works with Health and Wellness staff for the collection of drug test specimens, documentation of results and provision of results to students. Works with the Center Standards Officer for consultation with students regarding positive results leading to separation from the program.

· Provides individual counseling for students regarding substance abuse and prevention, and healthy choices.

· Prepares and facilitates group sessions with students enrolled in the center’s TEAP program.

· Conducts weekly Presentation(s) on managing substance misuse, abuse, and dependency symptoms and issues in the workplace for students during the Career Development and Transition Periods.

**· Develops and facilitates three annual center-wide substance use prevention and education activities.**

**· Conducts in-service training sessions with both staff and students in all areas related to substance use and abuse.**

**· Submits recommendations to the Center Director for medical separations related to substance misuse and abuse in conjunction with the Mental Health Consultant, center physician, and Health and Wellness Director.** 

· Utilizing formalized assessment measures (e.g., SASSI3 or SASSIA2, MAST and DAST), and clinical judgment to determine students’ level of risk for substance use.

· Participates in the center’s Healthy Eating and Active Lifestyle (HEALS) Committee that supports healthy eating and active lifestyles and provides students with education and experiences that promote lifelong health and physical well-being.

**Qualifications:**

**Minimum:** Active, unrestricted substance abuse license or certification that meets minimum state licensing or certification requirements to practice in the state where the center is located.

**Preferred**: Bachelor’s degree in related field. Previous experience with disadvantaged youth, particularly in a residential setting, is highly desirable.

**Knowledge:** Broad-based knowledge of counseling techniques. Knowledgeable in alcohol and other drugs of abuse and relapse programs. Ability to design, develop and implement a program related to alcohol and other drugs of abuse and intervention. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written. Training skills in both individual and group counseling methods. Ability to relate well to young adults. Must possess and maintain valid CPR/First Aid certification. Ability to use center computer programs and Microsoft Office including but not limited to PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.

title: SAT English Tutors Needed
description:
Our part time tutors have flexible schedules that allow them to connect with students individually doing what they do best-TEACHING!

**About Huntington Learning Center**

Huntington Learning Center, established in 1977, is the nation's oldest and most respected provider of supplemental education. The mission of each Huntington Learning Center is to give every student the best education possible. We accomplish this through individualized curriculum based on the results of each student's diagnostic testing results. We work with students in the basic skill areas of reading, writing, math, phonics, and study skills. We also prepare students for the ACT and SAT exams. This is a great opportunity to work in an environment that makes a difference in our children's lives.

**Benefits of working at Huntington Learning Center**:

· **Paid Training**: We offer continual training that even experienced professionals appreciate. Huntington skills and techniques can be transferred to your place of employment.

· **Students**: Work with a variety of students at all grade levels on an individual or one-to-one basis. As you track students' academic progress, you will see marked improvement in their skills, confidence, and motivation. There are no discipline problems, so you can concentrate on the academics. Since full-time staff conducts all parent discussions, you have no interaction with parents.

· **No outside work**: With no homework to correct or lesson plans to develop, you just walk into the Center and begin teaching. Everything is ready for you.

· **Year-round flexible hours**: Our evening and weekend hours adapt to your schedule. Since no preparation is needed, it's an ideal part-time job.

**Requirements:**

· Minimum Bachelors Degree

· Teaching Certificate preferred but not required

· Flexible and Reliable. Willing to work a minimum of 2 days per week

· Enthusiastic

· Strong desire to make a difference in the lives of children

**Join The Huntington Team**

Does this sound like you? Are you excited to see students grow and succeed? At Huntington you will be a part of a dynamic, positive, and supportive team as we focus together to build students’ skills, confidence and motivation.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person
company_description: Huntington Learning Center is headquartered in Oradell, New Jersey with nearly 300 franchised learning centers in operation across the country.

title: Inside Sales Rep--- Customer Service/Sales phone exp preferred
description:
**INSIDE SALES REPRESENTATIVE**

**Company Overview:**

We are a reputable debt restructuring company specializing in providing financial solutions and relief to small businesses facing challenging economic circumstances. Our mission is to empower small businesses by offering customized debt restructuring services that enable them to regain financial stability and sustain long-term growth. We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Inside Sales Representative to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in reaching out to potential clients through cold calling.

**Job Summary:**

As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be an integral part of our sales team, responsible for prospecting, reaching out, and building relationships with small business owners seeking debt restructuring solutions. Your primary focus will be cold calling potential clients, identifying their financial challenges, and introducing our tailored debt restructuring services. The successful candidate will be a persuasive communicator, adept at handling objections, and passionate about helping small businesses thrive despite financial difficulties.

**Responsibilities**:

· Conduct outbound calls to prospective customers to introduce our products/services and generate sales leads.

· Qualify leads and identify potential customers' needs and requirements.

· Present and demonstrate our products/services to potential clients through phone calls, emails, and virtual meetings.

· Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, providing exceptional customer service and addressing any inquiries or concerns.

· Collaborate with the sales team to develop and implement effective sales strategies and tactics.

· Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets and objectives.

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of sales activities and customer interactions in the CRM system.

· Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to identify new business opportunities.

· Continuously enhance product knowledge and sales skills through training and professional development opportunities.

**Requirements**:

· Proven experience in inside sales or a similar sales role, preferably in a B2B environment.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish trust with customers.

· Strong negotiation and persuasion abilities.

· Self-motivated and target-oriented, with a drive to achieve and exceed sales goals.

We offer a base salary and commission!

We offer training!

We offer a fast-paced and team-oriented environment!

Check out our website: www.nuvisionresolve.com

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**About Chefman**
Chefman is a leading global brand of small kitchen appliances.
We are a team of bold thinkers and doers, collaborative and passionate, creating innovative cooking experiences. We get excited about designing products that blend the best of utility, beauty, and quality, delighting millions of customers worldwide.
As the fastest growing brand in our space, you can go as far as your ambitions take you. Joining Chefman sets you up to do some of the most impactful work of your career.
**About CHEF iQ**
Arising from Chefman's innovative and bold mindset, the CHEF iQ brand was launched with the simple idea that cooking should be approachable and enjoyable by all.
With intelligence and purpose, we are designing the next generation of innovative hardware, cutting edge software, and next level culinary content to deliver a seamless and immersive culinary experience that guarantees flawless results.
Joining CHEF iQ means becoming part of a passionate team of problem solvers pushing the boundaries of what was thought possible in the kitchen, redefining the future of cooking.
**Job Description**
The Technical Project Manager is responsible for all of the various activities necessary to bring a product from inception to production on time, on budget while ensuring all technical requirements are properly met.
**Roles and Responsibilities:**
* Work closely with engineering, product management, and sales teams to ensure project objectives and business goals are met.
* The TPM defines 'WHAT' and 'WHEN' for deliverables, while engineers focus on 'HOW' to achieve them.
* Oversee and drive new product development across multiple projects.
* Address and resolve technical challenges to overcome project blockers.
* Collaborate with engineers to jointly manage new product development and market introduction.
* Identify and address project risks and issues, implementing mitigations to minimize impact.
* Engage with all stakeholders to motivate, identify issues, propose solutions, and enhance efficiency.
* Independently and collaboratively identify, implement, and validate technical solutions.
* Prepare and deliver regular project updates and dashboards to senior management, highlighting status and milestones.
* Develop and review test procedures and manage product testing throughout the development cycle.
* Ensure that global teams are aligned with the project direction and updated on status and key issues.


**Qualifications and Skills:**
* Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Electrical or Mechanical Engineering is preferable)
* Experience of working in fast paced, challenging environment
* Experience in interacting with engineering, manufacturing, and external partners both domestically and internationally.
* At least 3 years in hardware consumer product development.
* successfully launched at least one hardware product with cross functional dependencies, either as an engineer or project manager
* Monday.com or Jira
* eDrawings/SW/PTC Creo
* Data analyzing
* Office 365

title: Billing Assistant
company: Tectonic Engineering Consultants, Geologists & Land Surveyors, D.P.C.
description:
**Tectonic is currently seeking a full-time Billing Assistant to join our accounting team based within our Mountainville, NY Office!**
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Run reports and compile necessary documentation to meet project specific billing backup requirements using various software programs, including Deltek Vision, Microsoft Excel, and NitroPDF;
* Maintain accounts receivable documentation and backup, including updating databases, manual and/or electronic filing, reporting, resolving backup issues, and all other related documentation as required;
* Maintain ongoing communication with regional and corporate accounting teams to ensure successful billing of projects and communicate with Project Managers as needed to gain additional required information;
* Maintain organizational system to keep project backup requests streamlined and efficient to meet billing needs;
* Assist with various other day to day functions of accounts receivable as needed.

**QUALIFICATIONS**
* Minimum of 1 year of relevant administrative experience, with a basic understanding of accounts receivable;
* HS Diploma or equivalent is required; Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree in a related field is a plus;
* Strong computer skills, with a strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and the ability to learn client and project specific programs;
* Strong organizational skills, with ability to prioritize work and assist with a high volume of billing requirements;
* Excellent oral and written communication skills;
* Must be self-motivated, able to work efficiently, adapt easily, and be very detail oriented, as accuracy is essential.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**
In order to perform the essential functions of this position, the candidate must be able to constantly assume a stationary position, and must handle and/or feel documents, materials, and/or equipment to perform necessary tasks, sometimes repetitively. The candidate must be able to occasionally maneuver within the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc., and may exert up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally. Constantly, they must be able to receive and convey detailed or important information with others via the Corporate e-mail system, telephone system, and in person.
The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
**COMPETITIVE SALARY & BENEFITS PACKAGE**
In addition to providing competitive salaries, Tectonic offers a wide range of benefit options, including:
* Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
* Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
* Tuition reimbursement
* Paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal
* Company–observed paid holidays
* Short and long-term disability coverage
* Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care
* Commuter benefit plan for public transportation costs
* 401K retirement and profit sharing plan.
**PAY RANGE**
*Tectonic’s goal is to compensate employees fairly and equitably across all positions Companywide. Our advertised pay ranges are representative of our good faith effort to provide a reasonable anticipated salary range. The offered pay may be outside of the provided salary range based upon the selected candidate’s work location, experience, education, certifications, and capabilities compared to the advertised position.*
Pay Range: $20.00 - $22.00 / hour
***We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class.*** ***Tectonic participates in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.***

title: Public Relations Manager
description:
Job Summary
  

.
**PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF POSITION:**The Public Relations Manager is responsible for executing public relations initiatives that firmly position *The Langham, New York, Fifth Avenue* as New York’s leading luxury hotel. The Marketing Manager is responsible for creating and maintaining Public Relations strategies to meet objectives and enhance the image of the hotel. Supports Director of Sales and Marketing in the conceptualization and execution of a comprehensive and strategic marketing and public relations plan to build awareness of the hotel on a local, national and international level for all room segments and programming initiatives. Provides support on multiple marketing initiatives including but not limited to collateral development, partnership development, data base and website management, social networking initiatives and direct marketing.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES AND JOB DUTIES:*** Develops external public relations strategy and initiatives that enhance the public image of The Langham, New York, Fifth Avenue. Serves as agency’s partner on execution of this plan.
* Establish professional relationships with local and national media to gain cooperation and immediate respect as a source of reliable, newsworthy information.
* Initiate and write creative pitches to attract publication interest.
* Integrate social media platform content with public relations activities to ensure reputation management and demonstrate TLNYC innovation.
* Communicate effectively with celebrities, business community, press, heads-of-state and royalty.
* Spearhead public relations agency efforts in the production and distribution of creative media releases, media familiarization visits, media kits, and special event management.
* Follow-up with media as necessary.
* Develop and cultivate relationships with key media players and the travel industry to achieve the goals of the hotel.
* Identify opportunities for media coverage and ensure that such angles are pitched to reporters and editors to increase Langham’s visibility in print, broadcast and online news outlets on the local, national and international levels.
* Develop and direct internal communications program through effective and timely communications with all Langham New York employees and Langham Hotels’ employees.
* Develop and oversee strategic social media plan (integrate with marketing initiatives, respond to social media reviews, etc.)
* Coordinate photo and video shoots to support public relations/social media initiatives.
* Maximize opportunities for publicity in all media, highlighting the differentiators of The Langham, New York experience.
* Make appointments and travel as needed to meet media and press contacts.
* Consult with marketing and sales to develop communication strategies that support guest retention, generate revenue and increase brand loyalty.
* Entertain on-property to ensure a Langham experience is enjoyed in the food and beverage outlets and spa.
* Serve as the primary Langham, New York media spokesperson, or designate a department person to act in this capacity.
* Position employee, management and other spokespersons to be a resource for media and prepare them for print and broadcast interviews.
* Present opportunities for corporate sponsorships, charitable efforts and partnerships to Manager of Marketing and ultimately write proposals, and coordinate program implementation.
* Build and network community relations by attending receptions, dinners and galas, serve on selected organizations and committees as needed and perform other duties as may be assigned by Manager of Sales and Marketing.
* Help develop and plan events with potential for external publicity.
* Serve as a member of the crisis communications team.
* Conduct research to keep department abreast of developments and trends in the media.
* Write and serve as editor for a variety of print and web communications for internal and external audiences including press releases, annual reports, executive speeches, internal publications and ensuring that all materials are reflective of The Langham brand.
* Plan, facilitate and execute media events, trips and appointments both at The Langham, New York and off-property.
* All other responsibilities assigned by management.
* Maintain complete knowledge of all hotel services/features and hours of operation.
* Identify, create and lead unique public relations activities with goal of achieving “best practice” recognition within LHG.
* Maintain complete knowledge of and comply with all hotel and departmental policies and procedures.
* Access all functions of computer according to specifications with an emphasis on Microsoft Word and Windows applications.
* Promote positive relations with guests and employees.
* Maintain high level of knowledge in reference to The Langham product.
* Maintain high level of knowledge of the competition's product.
* Maintain good relationships with counterparts at competing hotels; promote all Langham Hotels whenever possible.
* Design and work within market plan; maintain file database.
* Administer staff performance reviews on a timely basis.
* Ensure financial success of hotel by overseeing PR expenses and ensuring that special events deliver an appropriate ROI for hotel.
  

  

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**Sitting occurs approximately 50% of the time. Employee may sit up to 5 hours a day. 50% of tasks may be performed from a non-seated position. These tasks may include touring the hotel and traveling to and from meetings. These and other tasks require sitting, standing, walking, lifting, reaching, pushing, pulling and grasping. Length of time of these tasks may vary from day to day and task to task.  

  

  

Requirement
  

.
**SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:**

* College degree recommended. Concentration in Marketing, Business or Communications preferred.
* Strong writing skills with mastery of punctuation, grammar and sentence structure.
* Imaginative mind to create distinct hotel press pitches that distinguish Langham New York from other hotels.
* Ideal candidate will possess strong relationships with key members of the media, civic, arts and philanthropic community and have a proven track record of successful publicity campaigns and media relations initiatives.
* Ability to prioritize, organize work assignments and follow-up. Execute a multitude of tasks in a timely basis.
* Ability to promote positive relationships with guests and staff.
* Ability to perform job function with minimal supervision even under pressure.
* Ability to ensure security and confidentiality of guests and hotel data.
* Ability to enforce hotel's quality procedures, etc.
* Ability to work independently without direct supervision or cohesively as a team.
* Ability to be a clear thinker, analyze and resolve problems exercising good judgment.
* Ability to input and access information into a computer.
* Ability to remain calm and courteous with demanding/difficult situations.
* Ability to work long hours, 5-6 days a week.
* Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
* Ability to interface confidently with high profile customers and media.
* Extremely detail-oriented task mastering abilities.
* All other responsibilities assigned by management.
  

**EDUCATION REQUIRED:**Bachelor’s Degree preferred; however, any combination of education and training within hotel sales may also be considered.  

  

**EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:**A minimum of 3-5 years in sales and marketing with direct experience in public relations and/or marketing.  

  

**LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES:**None needed.  

**Salary range: $83-87k**  

**EOE, including disability/vets**

  

  

Terms of employment
  

. Full time

title: On Call Housekeeping Ambassador
description:
Job Summary
  

.
**PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF POSITION:**The Housekeeping Ambassador will be primarily responsible for maintaining and enhancing the guests’ in-room experience. The objective is to provide a seamless experience for all Housekeeping needs of the guests.
To provide housekeeping services to all guest rooms including minibar, guest floor corridors, stairwells, and public areas according to the policies and procedures established by Langham. Coordinate guest and employee laundry/dry cleaning. Perform general administrative tasks in support of the Housekeeping department.
Knowledge of the Langham Brand and Forbes standards is required.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES AND JOB DUTIES:*** Provide housekeeping services in guestrooms that will include but not limited to:
	+ Clean bathtub, toilet, sink, walls, mirrors, tiles, counters, and floor surfaces using cloths, mops sponges, brushes, and/or cleaning agents by extending arms over head, bending and stooping.
	+ Strip and make beds, changing bed linens, which may require lifting bedspreads weighing a maximum of 40 lbs.
	+ Dust all furniture, pictures, drawers, window ledges, and shelves thoroughly.
	+ Make up rollaway beds and cribs as needed.
	+ Polish marble and deep clean carpet.
	+ Replenish amenities, linens, and supplies in guest room.
	+ Flip mattresses and move furniture as assigned.
	+ Must report all defects observed in the room to prevent these from affecting guests. Defects must be reported via the HotSOS system. Guestrooms must be defect free before being occupied by guests. Stayover rooms must adhere to the same standards.
	+ Practices chemical safety rules and follows procedures for needles and other hazardous materials.
	+ Ensures all collateral in room looks brand new.
	+ Disposal of waste from guest rooms while actively participating in the recycling program.
	+ Sign for room keys and issued devices. Visually inspect room for cleanliness and appearance and signify completion of service of room.
* Provide housekeeping services in corridors, public areas and back of house that will include but not limited to:
	+ Keeping housekeeping storage areas and linen closets neat and secure.
	+ Ensure all areas are kept free of clutter and trash. This includes all public spaces, public restrooms, fitness center, porte-cochere, offices and locker rooms.
	+ Dispose of waste from public areas and guest floor landing areas.
	+ Ensure trash room is kept clean and organized.
	+ Replenish minibar items in guest rooms. Ensure that minibar storage is kept clean and organized.
	+ Prepare all dirty linen for transport to laundry service company. This includes pulling linen from the laundry chute and pushing heavy linen carts.
	+ Responsible for the maintenance of the linen chute.
	+ Turn in all guest items left behind in guestrooms to the Loss Prevention Department.
* Coordinate guest and employee laundry/dry cleaning including but not limited to:
	+ Facilitate the purchasing of uniforms for new colleagues; issue and make necessary alterations as needed.
	+ Size, issue and properly document uniforms for colleagues.
	+ Responsible for pressing of guests’ clothes following hotel standards on quality and timing
	+ Document and coordinate guest and hotel management laundry/dry cleaning and hotel uniforms to be picked up and cleaned by laundry service company.
	+ Inspect condition, charges and amount of cleaned items received from laundry service company; resolve any discrepancies.
	+ Organize all cleaned laundry/dry cleaning and uniforms into designated racks and conveyor slots.
	+ Remove substandard uniforms from circulation and reassign replacements.
	+ Monitor and maintain accurate records of all assigned and unassigned uniforms.
	+ Report all shortages, damages, maintenance requests, problems and linen/uniform availability to manager.
	+ Stock closets with all supplies and linen as directed. Obtain amenities and supplies for as directed.
	+ Respond in a timely manner to guest requests for items such as an iron, safety instructions, assistance, direction, and/or other information as requested.
	+ Report all suspicious persons, activities or hazardous conditions to the Loss Prevention Department.
	+ Turn in all items found in employee's work area to the Loss Prevention Department.
* Perform general administrative tasks in support of the Housekeeping department that will include but not limited to:
	+ Manage database and run required reports (knowledge of SEP, HotSOS, Excel, Word, etc. preferred)
	+ Communicate effectively within the department and with other departments
	+ Process requisitions and purchase orders.
	+ Prepare guestroom assignments for all shifts within the day and facilitate changes as needed.
	+ Create turndown assignments and all required reports. Close the house at the end of the day and coordinate with Front Office accordingly.
	+ Maintain inventory record and perform regular inventory count.

* Other duties as assigned by management. Assist other colleagues as needed.
  
**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:*** Physical activities include kneeling, crouching, bending, stooping, pushing, pulling, walking, talking, seeing, hearing, bending, handling, feeling, reaching, stretching, grasping.
* Ability to work alone in an established routine.
* Requires walking up to 90 - 95 % of workday.
* Ability to lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 lbs with frequent lifting and or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 lbs.
* Requires repetitive motion of the hands, wrists, shoulders and back with repeated bending and stooping.
  
  

  

Requirement
  

.
**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:*** Physical activities include kneeling, crouching, bending, stooping, pushing, pulling, walking, talking, seeing, hearing, bending, handling, feeling, reaching, stretching, grasping.
* Ability to work alone in an established routine.
* Requires waling up to 90-95% of workday
* Ability to lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 lbs with frequent lifting and/or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 lbs.
* Requires repetitive motion of the hands, wrists, shoulders, and back with repeated bending and stooping
  

  

**SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:*** Ability to scrub and scour surfaces, extending arms over head to perform cleaning tasks, and work in confined spaces.
* Experience in marble, carpet, window and general cleaning needed.
* Knowledge of stain removal and chemical cleaning agents and SEPtion of different types of equipment.
* Ability to comprehend and follow instructions from supervisor.
* Ability to learn and apply Hazardous Chemical and training standards during new hire introductory period.
* Ability to follow instructions, directions, and meet deadlines, including the thorough cleaning of assigned guest rooms as specified by management.
* Basic ability to comprehend English language sufficient to understand information such as labels and instructions, basic guest requests, and emergency instructions.
* Ability to effectively deal with internal and external clients, listen effectively, to speak and write English clearly.
* Ability to utilize computer – prefer experience with SEP, HotSOS, Word, Excel.
* Thorough organization and time management skills to complete tasks efficiently and timely.
  

**EDUCATION REQUIRED:*** High School graduate preferred or any combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skill, and ability.
  
  

**EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:*** Previous housekeeping experience in a luxury setting preferred.
  
  

**LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES:*** None needed.
  
**Rate of pay: $37.15 per hour**  

**EOE, including disability/vets**

title: Security Guard, High School Grades 9-12
company: The NYC Charter High School AECI
description:
**Position:** Security Guard, High School Grades 9-12

**The School**  
The New York City Charter High School for Architecture Engineering & Construction Industries is a high school located in the South Bronx. We employ research proven strategies to raise our students’ academic achievement. We received national recognition from US News and World Reports for being a high performing charter high school and are high ranking in district 7 for impact and performance.  
We seek to develop the academic and social skills in our students which will help them build a foundation for the challenges of high school and the skills necessary for college and careers in the 21st century. Our school has earned a 97% student graduation rate, with many of our students achieving Advanced Regents diplomas and receiving scholarships to college. We work extensively to promote academic, moral, and character development in all students so they may learn the various aspects of tolerance, respect, and understanding for one another.

**The Position:** Security Guard, High School

Responsibilities

* Monitor and assist with student entry and exit throughout the day
* Cafeteria duty to monitor and maintain order during student lunch periods
* Assist with student movement during change of period throughout the day
* Attend weekly meetings addressing current issues in the workplace
* Attend professional development sessions when provided throughout the school year
* Work overtime when necessary in order to cover athletic sporting events, open house, parent-teacher conferences, student activities and other various high school events
* Assist in moving students to proper locations during fire drills, special assemblies and events
* Ensure the safety of students under your supervision
* Encourage and ensure that students adhere to all school policies. (Uniform, Cell Phones, ID’s, etc...)

**Qualifications:**

* Must have security guard certification for both 8 hour and 16 hour class
* High School experience preferred but not required
* Desire to work in a teacher – driven, student - centered environment
* Ability to work well with colleagues

title: Entry Level Environmental Scientist
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Entry Level Scientist to join our dynamic team. This position is ideal for recent graduates or individuals looking to start their career in scientific research. The successful candidate will assist in various research projects, contributing to data collection, analysis, and technical documentation. This role offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a laboratory setting while working alongside experienced professionals.

**Duties**  
- Conduct scientific research and experiments under the supervision of senior scientists.  
- Collect and analyze data using various methodologies and tools.  
- Assist in the preparation of technical reports and documentation related to research findings.  
- Utilize GPS and GIS technologies for data mapping and analysis.  
- Maintain laboratory equipment and ensure compliance with safety protocols.  
- Participate in fieldwork, including gardening activities related to research projects.  
- Collaborate with team members on various projects, contributing ideas and insights.

**Skills**  
- Strong background in scientific research methodologies.  
- Mechanical knowledge for operating laboratory equipment effectively.  
- Proficient in technical writing for creating clear and concise reports.  
- Familiarity with data collection techniques and tools.  
- Experience with GIS software for spatial data analysis is a plus.  
- Excellent analytical skills for interpreting research data accurately.  
- Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.  
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

This Entry Level Scientist position is an exciting opportunity for individuals passionate about science and eager to contribute to meaningful research initiatives. Join us in making a difference through innovative scientific exploration!

Are you looking for a challenging role that allows you to leverage the personal connections you have in the community? Are you energized by achieving sales goals, closing the deal, and gaining market share? If so, Right at Home has a **COMMUNITY LIASON** position just for you!


We are a locally owned home care business that has an extraordinary culture. We are looking for great talent who can work in a fast-paced environment and who have exceptional skills in relationship-based sales, community engagement, organization and data-driven sales strategies.


The position will be based out of our Old Bridge location and will cover **Central New Jersey**.


We offer paid healthcare, training and development opportunities, and a competitive salary with quarterly bonus potential.


The **COMMUNITY** **LIASON** is responsible for promoting sales and creating a positive identity for the company through promotional material and personal visits thru all of the hospitals and rehabs thru Southern Middlesex County.

* Plays the integral role in helping Right at Home improve the lives of as many people as possible in our community.
* Increases care hours, develops a profitable referral source pipeline, and gains market share.
* Pre-plans weekly sales activities, creates opportunities for communication with referral sources, and maintains all sales activity in a Customer Relationship Manager database.
* Conveys a strong need to win, doesn’t give up, and is energized by developing and meeting annual sales goals.
* The ideal candidate has a successful sales track record in increasing market share and has prior experience working in the home care or healthcare industries.


The desired candidate will possess the following:

* High school graduate or equivalent with two years of business experience.
* Able to work independently, demonstrating sound judgment.
* Be available as required for on-call duty outside of normal office hours.

title: Lead Project Controls Specialist - 90377167 - New York
description:
**Your success is a train ride away!**


As we move America’s workforce toward the future, Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority, and the success of our railroad is due to our employees.

 **Are you ready to join our team?**


Our values of ‘Do the Right Thing, Excel Together and Put Customers First’ are at the heart of what matters most to us, and our Core Capabilities, ‘Building Trust, Accountability, Effective Communication, Customer Focus, and Proactive Safety & Security’ are what every employee needs to know and do to be most impactful at Amtrak. By living the Amtrak values, focusing on our capabilities, and actively embracing and fostering diverse ideas, backgrounds, and perspectives, together we will honor our past and make Amtrak a company of the future.

 **SUMMARY OF DUTIES:**  

The Lead Project Controls Specialist is a support role responsible for assisting in the financial reporting of delivery of a large-scale program with multimillion-dollar cost impacts and multi-year delivery schedule. The reporting may encompass multiple projects, cross-departmental interfaces, multiple technologies, geographies and assets. Individuals in this role work independently with some indirect supervision from Sr. Program Director and Controls direct supervision of Program Manager Controls. This position is responsible for working with and supporting the reporting and data analytics team to ensure accurate, timely and insightful reporting that supports data-driven decision-making across the organization. The role requires regular analytical and Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) reporting to other staff, Executive Committee, and stakeholders.

 **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**  

* Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) for different projects.
* Analyze performance data, financial reports, and operational metrics to provide valuable insight.
* Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by implementing data quality control measures.
* Effectively communicate findings and insights to senior management and relevant stakeholders.
* Develop forecasts and predictive models to assist in decision-making processes.
* Manage a team of analysts responsible for data, collection, analysis, and railroad reporting.
* Continuously identify and implement process improvements to enhance reporting efficiency and accuracy.
* Ensure compliance with FRA regulatory requirements and internal policies related to reporting and data management.
* Understanding of relevant regulations and compliance standards in the Transportation Industry.
* Proactively identify and mitigate risks, ensuring the organization's operations are resilient to external challenges.
* Ensure strict adherence to industry regulations and company policies maintaining a high level of compliance.
* Conduct regular audits to verify compliance and implement corrective action as necessary.
* Ensure adherence to the Amtrak Program Management methods and governance standards.
 **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelor’s degree
* Project controls reporting and analysis experience
* Strong project management skills and program support experience
* Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, MS Project)
* Superb communication and stakeholder management skills with a focus on collaboration, team building, and customer service
* Effectiveness working diplomatically across teams with varying objectives.
* Ability to work independently and maintain confidentiality.
* Ability to multi-task and thrive in an environment where information is required to be provided quickly and accurately.
* Must have work authorization in the United States.

 **PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* 6+ years Project controls reporting and analysis experience – Amtrak preferred.
* Experience with various types of reporting (track usage, outages, etc.) in the transportation industry environment.
* Experience with project management on large-scale, multi-year complex construction projects.
* Experience with project management software (Primavera P6, Microsoft Project Server).

 **WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

* Office building environment.
* Work in cubicle setting; stand, sit, bend, twist, use file drawers.
* Sit at computer to complete assignments, projects, and majority of tasks.
* Ability to work under pressure.
* Travel 25%
 **COMMUNICATIONS AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:**


Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.

  

The salary range is $94,300-$122,256. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. Depending on an employee’s assigned worksite or location, Amtrak may consider a geo-pay differential to be applied to the employee’s base salary. Amtrak may offer additional incentive and pay programs to recognize and reward our employees, including a short-term incentive bonus based upon factors such as individual and company performance that is commensurate with the level of the position and/or long-term incentive plan compensation. In addition to your salary, Amtrak offers a comprehensive benefit package that includes health, dental, and vision plans; health savings accounts; wellness programs; flexible spending accounts; 401K retirement plan with employer match; life insurance; short and long term disability insurance; paid time off; back-up care; adoption assistance; surrogacy assistance; reimbursement of education expenses; Public Service Loan Forgiveness eligibility; Railroad Retirement sickness and retirement benefits; and rail pass privileges. Learn more about our benefits offerings here.

  

#LI-CD1

**Requisition ID:**162336  

**Posting Location(s):**New York

**Work Arrangement:**04-Hybrid Weekly  

**Job Family/Function:**Research & Strategy  

**Relocation Offered:**No  

**Travel Requirements:**Up to 25%

**You power our progress through your performance.**

  

We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job. We want your career at Amtrak to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging work, rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, and attractive compensation. Amtrak maintains a culture that values high performance and recognizes individual employee contributions.

  

Amtrak is committed to a safe workplace free of drugs and alcohol. All Amtrak positions requires a pre-employment background check that includes prior employment verification, a criminal history check and a pre-employment drug screen.


Candidates who test positive for marijuana will be disqualified, regardless of any state or local statute, ordinance, regulation, or other law that legalizes or decriminalizes the use or possession of marijuana, whether for medical, recreational, or other use. Amtrak's pre-employment drug testing program is administered in accordance with DOT regulations and applicable law.

  

In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR § 40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety-sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, the individual will not be permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.

  

In accordance with federal law governing security checks of covered individuals for providers of public transportation (Title 6 U.S.C. §1143), Amtrak is required to screen applicants for any permanent or interim disqualifying criminal offenses.

  

Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

  

Amtrak is an EOE/Affirmative Action Minority/Female employer, and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race/color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related conditions), national origin/ethnicity, age, disability (intellectual, mental and physical), veteran status, marital status, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, genetic information, citizenship or any other personal characteristics protected by law.

title: Experienced Service Advisor
description:
***We are currently seeking Experienced and Skilled Service Advisors to join our growing team!***

United Ford is a top dealer in tri-state area and we are expanding! Located in Secaucus, NJ, we are looking for skilled and dynamic service advisors to join our team.

Our dealership aims to maintain a high level of customer satisfaction that extends past the initial sale. While the Sales Department strives to provide innovative and cost-effective vehicles, our Service and Parts departments will aim to minimize downtime and provide our team with the tools needed for success.

As a Service Advisor, you will be responsible for communicating with customers to determine which repairs are necessary, submitting work orders to technicians, ordering needed parts and collecting payment after repairs are completed. In addition, you will build rapport with customers to promote customer satisfaction and customer retention.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Greet customers in a timely, friendly manner and obtain pertinent vehicle information
* Advise customers on the care and the value of maintaining their vehicles in accordance with manufacturers’ specifications
* Upsell additional services or products as needed
* Generate and provide customers with a complete and accurate estimate of repair orders
* Establish and communicate completion time of repair with customer and technician
* Answer incoming service calls
* Maintain and schedule service appointments
* Follow prescribed procedures for customer post follow-up resulting in return visits, increased sales and excellent CSI
* Follow the manufacturer’s warranty guidelines and procedures
* Comply with all federal, state and local laws, and company policy, regarding the safeguarding all customer, company and manufacturer information, as well as customers vehicle and property

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Must be able to manage in a fast paced work environment with limited supervision.
* Must have great customer service skills.
* **Previous experience highly preferred; commercial truck experience a +**
* Basic MS Office knowledge; computer software, internet proficiency, and general mathematic skills.
* Working knowledge of basic vehicle functions, characteristics, and operations.
* Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedural manuals.

\\*

If you are a dedicated individual with a passion for automotive service and customer satisfaction, apply now!
